findings.title: Use of tx.origin for authentication
findings.explanation: Using tx.origin for authentication can be exploited by phishing attacks. A malicious contract can trigger a call chain that makes tx.origin still equal to the original user, bypassing your authorization check.
findings.fix_suggestion: Use msg.sender instead of tx.origin to verify the immediate caller: `require(msg.sender == owner);`.

findings.title: Deprecated constructor syntax
findings.explanation: Defining the constructor using a function with the same name as the contract is deprecated in Solidity >=0.4.22. This may lead to confusion or errors in future compiler versions.
findings.fix_suggestion: Use the `constructor` keyword instead of the function name: `constructor() public { owner = msg.sender; }`.
